cut out.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to remove something by cutting round it
cut out.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The cancerous cells had to be cut out.
Billy showed me the article he’d cut out of the magazine.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to cut a shape from a piece of paper, cloth etc
cut out.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The children were cutting out squares from the scraps of material.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to stop something from happening or existing
cut out.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The idea behind these forms is to cut out fraud.
A catalytic converter will cut out 90% of carbon monoxide emissions.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to stop doing or eating something, especially because it might be bad for your health
cut out.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The current advice to pregnant women is to cut out alcohol.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to remove something from a piece of writing, especially because it might offend people
cut out.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Cut out the bit about racial prejudice.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[5].de: used to tell someone to stop doing something because it is annoying you
cut out.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Hey, you guys, cut it out – Mom’s trying to get some sleep.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to stop someone from doing something or being involved in something
cut out.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: The new rules will cut out 25% of people who were previously eligible to vote.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to have the qualities that you need for a particular job or activity
cut out.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: In the end, I decided I wasn’t cut out for the army.
Are you sure you’re really cut out to be a teacher?
cut out.translation[0].definitions[8].de: if an engine or machine cuts out, it suddenly stops working
cut out.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: The engine cut out halfway across the lake.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[9].de: to prevent light, sound etc from reaching somewhere
cut out.translation[0].definitions[9].ex: You’ll need sunglasses that will cut out harmful UV rays from the sun.
cut out.translation[0].definitions[10].d: to prevent someone from getting something, especially your money after your death
cut out.translation[0].definitions[10].e: Em’s father decided to cut her out of his will.
